register.name: ICC_MCTLR
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: nDS
bitField.description: Disable Security not supported.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PMHE
bitField.description: Priority Mask Hint Enable.

bitField.name: RM
bitField.description: SBZ.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1NS
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Non-secure EL1 and EL2.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1S
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Secure EL1.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL3
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at EL3.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1NS
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Non-secure.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1S
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Secure.

register.name: ICC_MSRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Monitor System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL3.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enable. Enables lower Exception level access to ICC_SRE and ICC_HSRE.

bitField.name: DIB
bitField.description: Disable IRQ bypass.

bitField.name: DFB
bitField.description: Disable FIQ bypass.

bitField.name: SRE
bitField.description: System Register Enable.

register.name: NSACR
register.description: Defines the Non-secure access permissions to Trace, Floating-point and Advanced SIMD functionality. Also includes additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED bits that define Non-secure access permissions for IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED functionality.

bitField.name: NSTRCDIS
bitField.description: Disables Non-secure CP14 accesses to all implemented trace registers, from all Privilege levels.

bitField.name: NSASEDIS
bitField.description: Disables Non-secure accesses to the Advanced SIMD functionality, from all Privilege levels.

bitField.name: cp11
bitField.description: Enable Non-secure access to the Floating-point and Advanced SIMD features.

bitField.name: cp10
bitField.description: Enable Non-secure access to the Floating-point and Advanced SIMD features.

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports disabling of security.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_disabling_of_security

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support disabling of security, and requires that security is not disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_disabling_of_security_and_requires_that_security_is_not_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support non-zero values of the Aff3 field in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_non_zero_values_of_the_Aff3_field_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports non-zero values of the Aff3 field in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_non_zero_values_of_the_Aff3_field_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support generation of SEIs.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_generation_of_SEIs

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports generation of SEIs.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_generation_of_SEIs

tcf:enumItem.description: 16 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _16_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: 24 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _24_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: Disables use of the priority mask register as a hint for interrupt distribution.
tcf:enumItem.name: Disables_use_of_the_priority_mask_register_as_a_hint_for_interrupt_distribution

tcf:enumItem.description: Enables use of the priority mask register as a hint for interrupt distribution.
tcf:enumItem.name: Enables_use_of_the_priority_mask_register_as_a_hint_for_interrupt_distribution

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts only. ICC_BPR1 determines the preemption group for Non-secure Group 1 interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts and Non-secure Group 1 interrupts. Non-secure accesses to GICC_BPR and ICC_BPR1 access the state of ICC_BPR0.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_and_Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts only. ICC_BPR1 determines the preemption group for Secure Group 1 interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts and Secure Group 1 interrupts. Secure accesses to ICC_BPR1 access the state of ICC_BPR0.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_and_Secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure EL1 accesses to Secure ICC_SRE trap to EL3. EL2 accesses to Non-secure ICC_SRE and ICC_HSRE trap to EL3. Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_SRE trap to EL3, unless these accesses are trapped to EL2 as a result of ICC_MSRE.Enable == 0.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_EL1_accesses_to_Secure_ICC_SRE_trap_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure EL1 accesses to Secure ICC_SRE do not trap to EL3. EL2 accesses to Non-secure ICC_SRE and ICC_HSRE do not trap to EL3. Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_SRE do not trap to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_EL1_accesses_to_Secure_ICC_SRE_do_not_trap_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: The memory-mapped interface must be used. Access at EL3 or below to any ICH_* System register, or any EL1, EL2, or EL3 ICC_* register other than ICC_SRE, ICC_HSRE, or ICC_MSRE, results in an Undefined Instruction exception.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_memory_mapped_interface_must_be_used

tcf:enumItem.description: The System register interface to the ICH_* registers and the EL1, EL2, and EL3 ICC_* registers is enabled for EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_System_register_interface_to_the_ICH_registers_and_the_EL1_EL2_and_EL3_ICC_registers_is_enabled_for_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: There is no effect on CPACR.TRCDIS or HCPTR.TTA.
tcf:enumItem.name: There_is_no_effect_on_CPACR

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure accesses to all implemented trace registers are disabled:
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_accesses_to_all_implemented_trace_registers_are_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: There is no effect on CPACR.ASEDIS or HCPTR.TASE.
tcf:enumItem.name: There_is_no_effect_on_CPACR

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure state accesses to the Advanced SIMD functionality are disabled:
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_state_accesses_to_the_Advanced_SIMD_functionality_are_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Floating-point and Advanced SIMD features can be accessed only from Secure state. Any attempt to access this functionality from Non-secure state is UNDEFINED. If the PE is in Non-secure state, the corresponding bits in the CPACR ignore writes and read as 00, access denied.
tcf:enumItem.name: Floating_point_and_Advanced_SIMD_features_can_be_accessed_only_from_Secure_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Floating-point and Advanced SIMD features can be accessed from both Security states.
tcf:enumItem.name: Floating_point_and_Advanced_SIMD_features_can_be_accessed_from_both_Security_states

tcf:enumItem.description: WFE instructions in modes other than Monitor mode are not trapped to Monitor mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: WFE_instructions_in_modes_other_than_Monitor_mode_are_not_trapped_to_Monitor_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt to execute a WFE instruction in any mode other than Monitor mode is trapped to Monitor mode, if the instruction would otherwise have caused the PE to enter a low-power state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_to_execute_a_WFE_instruction_in_any_mode_other_than_Monitor_mode_is_trapped_to_Monitor_mode_if_the_instruction_would_otherwise_have_caused_the_PE_to_enter_a_low_power_state

tcf:enumItem.description: WFI instructions in modes other than Monitor mode are not trapped to Monitor mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: WFI_instructions_in_modes_other_than_Monitor_mode_are_not_trapped_to_Monitor_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt to execute a WFI instruction in any mode other than Monitor mode is trapped to Monitor mode, if the instruction would otherwise have caused the PE to enter a low-power state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_to_execute_a_WFI_instruction_in_any_mode_other_than_Monitor_mode_is_trapped_to_Monitor_mode_if_the_instruction_would_otherwise_have_caused_the_PE_to_enter_a_low_power_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure state instruction fetches from Non-secure memory are permitted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_state_instruction_fetches_from_Non_secure_memory_are_permitted

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure state instruction fetches from Non-secure memory are not permitted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_state_instruction_fetches_from_Non_secure_memory_are_not_permitted

tcf:enumItem.description: HVC instructions are:
tcf:enumItem.name: HVC_instructions_are

tcf:enumItem.description: HVC instructions are enabled at PL2 and Non-secure PL1.
tcf:enumItem.name: HVC_instructions_are_enabled_at_PL2_and_Non_secure_PL1

tcf:enumItem.description: SMC instructions are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: SMC_instructions_are_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: In Non-secure state, SMC instructions are UNDEFINED. The Undefined Instruction exception is taken from the current Exception level to the current Exception level. In Secure state, behavior is one of the following:
tcf:enumItem.name: In_Non_secure_state_SMC_instructions_are_UNDEFINED

tcf:enumItem.description: Early termination permitted. Execution time of data operations can depend on the data values.
tcf:enumItem.name: Early_termination_permitted

tcf:enumItem.description: Disable early termination. The number of cycles required for data operations is forced to be independent of the data values.
tcf:enumItem.name: Disable_early_termination

tcf:enumItem.description: External aborts taken from Non-secure state are not masked by CPSR.A, and are taken to EL3. External aborts taken from Secure state are masked by CPSR.A.
tcf:enumItem.name: External_aborts_taken_from_Non_secure_state_are_not_masked_by_CPSR

tcf:enumItem.description: External aborts taken from either Security state are masked by CPSR.A. When CPSR.A is 0, the abort is taken to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: External_aborts_taken_from_either_Security_state_are_masked_by_CPSR

tcf:enumItem.description: An FIQ taken from Non-secure state is not masked by CPSR.F, and is taken to EL3. An FIQ taken from Secure state is masked by CPSR.F.
tcf:enumItem.name: An_FIQ_taken_from_Non_secure_state_is_not_masked_by_CPSR

tcf:enumItem.description: An FIQ taken from either Security state is masked by CPSR.F. When CPSR.F is 0, the FIQ is taken to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: An_FIQ_taken_from_either_Security_state_is_masked_by_CPSR

tcf:enumItem.description: External aborts taken to Abort mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: External_aborts_taken_to_Abort_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: External aborts taken to Monitor mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: External_aborts_taken_to_Monitor_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQs taken to FIQ mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQs_taken_to_FIQ_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQs taken to Monitor mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQs_taken_to_Monitor_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQs taken to IRQ mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQs_taken_to_IRQ_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQs taken to Monitor mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQs_taken_to_Monitor_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: PE is in Secure state.
tcf:enumItem.name: PE_is_in_Secure_state

tcf:enumItem.description: PE is in Non-secure state.
tcf:enumItem.name: PE_is_in_Non_secure_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Access to Performance Monitors registers from external debugger is permitted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Access_to_Performance_Monitors_registers_from_external_debugger_is_permitted

tcf:enumItem.description: Access to Performance Monitors registers from external debugger is disabled, unless overridden by the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: Access_to_Performance_Monitors_registers_from_external_debugger_is_disabled_unless_overridden_by_the_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED_authentication_interface

tcf:enumItem.description: Access to breakpoint and watchpoint registers from external debugger is permitted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Access_to_breakpoint_and_watchpoint_registers_from_external_debugger_is_permitted

tcf:enumItem.description: Access to breakpoint and watchpoint registers from external debugger is disabled, unless overridden by the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: Access_to_breakpoint_and_watchpoint_registers_from_external_debugger_is_disabled_unless_overridden_by_the_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED_authentication_interface

tcf:enumItem.description: Event counting prohibited in Secure state, unless overridden by the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: Event_counting_prohibited_in_Secure_state_unless_overridden_by_the_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED_authentication_interface

tcf:enumItem.description: Event counting allowed in Secure state, unless overridden by the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: Event_counting_allowed_in_Secure_state_unless_overridden_by_the_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED_authentication_interface

tcf:enumItem.description: Legacy mode. Debug exceptions from Secure EL1 are enabled by the authentication interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: Legacy_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure privileged debug disabled. Debug exceptions from Secure EL1 are disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_privileged_debug_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure privileged debug enabled. Debug exceptions from Secure EL1 are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_privileged_debug_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Performance Monitors event counting prohibited in Secure EL0 unless allowed by MDCR_EL3.SPME, SDCR.SPME, or the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface ExternalSecureNoninvasiveDebugEnabled().
tcf:enumItem.name: Performance_Monitors_event_counting_prohibited_in_Secure_EL0_unless_allowed_by_MDCR_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Performance Monitors event counting allowed in Secure EL0.
tcf:enumItem.name: Performance_Monitors_event_counting_allowed_in_Secure_EL0

tcf:enumItem.description: Debug exceptions other than Software Breakpoint Instruction exceptions from Secure EL0 are disabled, unless enabled by MDCR_EL3.SPD32 or SDCR.SPD.
tcf:enumItem.name: Debug_exceptions_other_than_Software_Breakpoint_Instruction_exceptions_from_Secure_EL0_are_disabled_unless_enabled_by_MDCR_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Debug exceptions from Secure EL0 are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Debug_exceptions_from_Secure_EL0_are_enabled
